image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: a Representative from North Carolina; born in Ironwood, Gogebic County, Mich., February 9, 1964; graduated from Madison High School, Madison Heights, Mich.; B.S., Oakland University, Rochester, Mich., 1990; registered nurse; hospital administrator; member of the Dunn, N.C., planning board, 2006-2010; chair, Dunn, N.C., planning board, 2008-2010; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Twelfth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2011-January 3, 2017); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016; regional director, United States Department of Health and Human Services, 2017-2019; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for lieutenant governor of North Carolina in 2020; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress in 2022.
